page.title: 02The Borough of Broxbourne
page.content: The Borough of Broxbourne (formed in 1974) has a population of approaching 75,000 and covers 20 square miles. Broxbourne stands on the banks of the River Lea. Towns in the Borough include, Waltham Cross, Cheshunt, Wormley, Broxbourne and Hoddesdon. Most of the houses in Broxbourne are quite old, and are preserved with loving care for their architectual and historical values. Broxbourne Railway Station, built 1840, was demolished in 1959 as a result of the Beeching rail cuts that affected England. The station was later re-built in its present location. Broxbourne Mill, built around 1910, was gutted by fire in 1952, and no longer exists. People have been living in the area since the stone-age.
